attributes.action: If a fathers name isn't on the birth certificate women shouldn't claim CSA
attributes.background: If women chose not to put the fathers name on the birth certificate they SHOULDN'T have the right to claim CSA unless both parents are on the certificate

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Poll Leave the EU Voters their reasons and present this to the EU before Brexit.
attributes.background: Anti-EU sentiment is not exclusive to the UK. With a Brexit, it is clear the EU will need to implement reforms to prevent other Nations from following suit. Why wait for the UK to leave the EU before reforming? Poll those who voted Leave for their reasons (it is currently not clear). Present these.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU should use this poll result of Leave voters to present reforms. The UK can then vote again that with these reforms, do we still want to leave the EU? 

Some may argue that David Cameron already asked for reforms. However, it is clear few really actually believed the UK would vote to leave. Now that it is clear, ask why the people voted this way and the EU should present new reforms. 

EU reforms will need to come. The EU has the chance now to do so before a Brexit actually happens.

attributes.action: Give young people of 13 years and over the right to vote in referenda.
attributes.background: I am 13.  People of my age will have to live with the decisions that adults made for us for years to come.  We need a say.  Young people are just as engaged as adults.  We have access to social media and information, and we take it in.  We want to secure our own futures.

attributes.action: Honour the Brexit result by repealing s2, European Communities Act 1972, NOW.
attributes.background: In view of another petition demanding that the Brexit result be ignored and another referendum held, we clearly need an alternative one that can be supported by all those who believe in democracy.

attributes.action: Referendum on making London a principality with right to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Following the overwhelming support from London voters for the UK to remain in the EU, we request that HM Government consider the option to allow London (as a principality of the U.K.) to remain in the EU - if necessary, following a second referendum/London-only vote.

attributes.action: Make London, Northern Ireland and Scotland an independent EU state.
attributes.background: The Majority of Scotland, Northern Ireland and London have voted to remain in the UK. So I ask Parliament to hold a referendum to make London Northern Ireland and Scotland a separate state of the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence as per EU Referendum results in press.

attributes.action: Bristol to receive a referendum to leave the UK and form an independent Nation
attributes.background: After vote leave won we believe that the United Kingdom does not speak or represent Bristol anymore and believe it better to move in a different direction from the UK

attributes.action: A referendum for Independence for London, and the South East England Counties.
attributes.background: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the EU. London & South East of England thrive on European trade and intrinsic links to global wealth and trade that it brings.
attributes.additional_details: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom held a referendum to on Europe. The local economies of "L&SE" (London and the South East) are driven by our intrinsic links to global trade and global wealth, and services to be provided around this. The EU is a vital component of these links.

attributes.action: An electronic voting system needs bringing in.
attributes.background: By moving forward from the outdated paper-based voting system you will squash a lot of the rumours of a rigged election as many people do not trust the governing body. I know many people who do not vote because they believe that their votes are essentially changed due to having to use a pencil.
attributes.additional_details: Not only would an updated voting system be a step in the right direction but also it wood make our country look better and more fair. People may also be able to trust an electronic voting system more than the current paper-based one.

attributes.action: Introduce a 3 strike policy before benefits can be sanctioned.
attributes.background: The use of automatic benefit sanctions is littered with examples of hardship incurred to those being sanctioned. There is no evidence that automatic benefit sanctions "help" people into work. It takes time to find a job, however anybody can have an emergency which causes them to miss an appointment.
attributes.additional_details:
http://tfne.ws/1him6Lp - "Half of all DWP sanctions wrongly imposed"
http://bit.ly/1Yex8Tr - "Warning vulnerable families are being pushed into poverty by wrongly imposed benefit sanctions"
http://bit.ly/1TYFXki - "A list of completely ridiculous benefit sanctions people have experienced"

attributes.action: Sporting events involving national team/competitor
attributes.background: It is absolutely disgraceful that I as a British national should have to pay to watch my national team compete in a sporting event. All sporting events involving any national team or competitor must by law be screened on terestrial television.

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox £15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Stop job discrimination against returning British Citizens
attributes.background: Government Departments have subcontracted recruitment companies (E.g. Capita) to manage the recruitment on their behalf. Some of these companies do not put forward candidates who have no been living in the UK for the past 3 - 5 years. This excludes British Citizens from working in the UK.

attributes.action: Ban door-to-door fundraising by large charities (so called 'doorstep chuggers')
attributes.background: This method of fundraising can be intrusive and where high pressure tactics are used by the fundraisers (who may in cases be remunerated based on the level of donation commitments they secure), can potentially put elderly or vulnerable persons in a position where they are taken advantage of.
attributes.additional_details: Our view is that attempts to regulate this form of fundraising activity seem ineffective and as such our petition is for an outright ban to make the position clearer on what is and is not allowed.

attributes.action: Require all computer operating systems have up/down scroll bar arrows.
attributes.background: For the past four years the Apple operating system, Mac OS X has had no up/down arrows on it's scroll bar. This was a none optional global change, so affects all software run in Mac OS X, even if it isn't Apple software. This causes difficulties for some disabled people and none disabled people too.
attributes.additional_details:
https://discussions.apple.com/thread/3196331?tstart=0
http://www.quicken.com/support/scrollbar-arrows-missing-using-quicken-lion-os
http://reverttosaved.com/2015/02/18/access-all-areas-why-even-apple-needs-to-rethink-regarding-accessibility/
https://discussions.apple.com/message/30209946#30209946
http://www.macworld.co.uk/news/mac/opinion-whats-wrong-mountain-lion-interface-3425603/

attributes.action: Petrol stations must offer the option to purchase fuel with a CO2 offset eg +1p
attributes.background: Driving my car contributes to global warming because burning fuel produces CO2. I would happily choose to pay an extra penny or so to offset my carbon, for example, by planting a tree. We will empower every driver to make a difference and show that Britain can lead the world in CO2 reduction.
attributes.additional_details:
It is very difficult for ordinary people to reduce the amount of CO2 that they produce. I have to heat my house in winter, drive to work and I like to go on holiday somewhere warm. Although I can reduce my consumption a bit, I can't reduce it enough to make a difference on my own. However if I work with other people I can make a difference.

 "Carbon offsetting" allows me to pay other people to reduce their CO2 emissions and "offset" my own. Here are some examples of offsetting projects https://www.bptargetneutral.com/uk/our-projects/a-global-portfolio/

attributes.action: Make letting agents pay double the holding deposit for cancelling a tenancy.
attributes.background: Currently, letting agents require future tenants to immediately pay holding fees which is later offset against administration and referencing fees. However if letting agent chose to cancel the tenancy, they just return the holding fees and not any interest rate or penalties.
attributes.additional_details: If a letting agent cannot make the property available as per agreed tenancy start date And if the tenancy agreement was not signed by both parties until that time, then tenant has no rights and has to bear substantial consequential losses. If tenant decides to negotiate and threaten to take to property ombudsman (for breach of implied contract), the letting agent can cancel the offer for tenancy by returning just the initial monies with no interest rate and with no penalty.

attributes.action: An alternative intergrated solution to Heathrow airport expansion
attributes.background:
Heathrow expansion can only exasperate West London’s housing and congestion problems.
I believe London’s future success and those of rest of UK will best be served by deliberately planning to reduce pressures on London's limited resources. 
Hence this proposal as a two prong solution.
attributes.additional_details:
1)Build a *new* international airport(linked to HS2), of similar size to Heathrow, around Birmingham. 
2)Divert half of all Heathrow's contracts to the new airport. Reducing pressures on London's resources. 
Some of the benefits are
•Sharing traffic between West/North of London. 
•More passenger capacity than a single runway extension.
•Help tourism/service industry in the north of UK. 
•In Emergencies, as both airports are of similar size, they can better cope with diversion of air traffic.

attributes.action: Stop taxing and means testing veterans service pensions
attributes.background: Veterans are not benefing from their service pensions due to taxation and means testing .

attributes.action: Reform faith school's religious studies to follow the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Faith schools are mostly run like other state schools. They have to follow the national curriculum except for religious studies, where they are free to only teach about their own religion.

The exclusion of other religions does not open students to other faiths and promotes ignorance.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/types-of-school/faith-schools

attributes.action: Mass build affordable homes to rent or buy. People can't afford to live!
attributes.background: House prices have increased to such a degree that even if you are approved for a mortgage, a moderate increase in interest rates will result in crippling poverty. For many a mortgage is impossible. Rent increases faster than wages. Isn't it time to address this problem?

attributes.action: Increase Maritime patrols / air surveillance at sea to protect the UK
attributes.background: Not enough patrol boats or air surveillance re intelligence and prevent terriosts traveling across the English Channel to gain entry into the UK.   Only five patrol boats currently. I reference 15/04/16 two Iranian men called 999 whilst floating in a small rubber boat in the sea

attributes.action: Ensure that fireworks remain unrestricted to the general public.
attributes.background: A petition to ensure that the general public can (and in future will be able to) purchase fireworks for home displays without undue restrictions.

attributes.action: Adopt British summer Time from mid February to mid November.
attributes.background:
Almost nobody looks forward to the clocks going back, at the end of October, and despite this, we persist with this oppressive schedule.  
My proposal is to adopt BST from Mid Feb to mid Nov. shortening the dark winter evenings.  I believe this would be very good for national morale.
attributes.additional_details:
It is said that the mornings are too dark in Scotland.  On the current regime, it is broad daylight in Edinburgh at 8.00 am by the end of January.  As a Scot, I am sure that mid February would be a good moment to move to BST.  It is a long haul through to the end of March. 
 
Light at the end of the day is far more useful for healthy recreation and exercise, and environmentally, less energy would be used with lighter evenings, because more people are up and about in the afternoon.

attributes.action: Remove the age limit from apprenticeships to help less experienced job seekers.
attributes.background: People age 24+ are very unlikely to find employment as an apprentice in many fields due to funding. We would like to change this so that apprenticeship vacancies no longer discriminate those in need of the training and experience required. We propose that the upper age limit be lifted.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone older than age 24 should be given a fair chance to gain employment as an apprentice. There are many unemployed people lacking the necessary training and experience in their desired field. 

Employment should not be ageist. 

If raising the age limit is beyond the Government's funding ability, they can introduce an option to allow the apprentice to take out a loan for the funding which could then be payed back in a similar fashion to higher education / university degree loans.

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: Create and support a Women in Engineering Charter
attributes.background: Theresa May recently celebrated the Women in Finance Charter to tackle gender inequality. The lack of STEM capability in the UK is becoming a crisis, we need to take action to ensure there are opportunities for all. We need a diverse industry to provide infrastructure and services for a diverse UK!
attributes.additional_details:
This is the Women in Finance Charter: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/women-in-finance-charter

Lets replicate this for the engineering, including technology, sector.

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action: Nationalise the M6 Toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is currently underused and is a resource that could be used more effectively under national ownership, this would help save time and money not only to businesses but to local and national economies and also help with air pollution experienced on the M6 which has heavy congestion.
attributes.additional_details:
Nationalising the M6 Toll would have numerous benefits from alleviating congestion on the M6 and surrounding roads to helping businesses and local economies of towns that are situated alongside the toll road such as Cannock which is currently having the Mill Green designer outlet village built. 
http://millgreenoutletvillage.co.uk/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35553865
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2015/sep/17/leaving-tackling-air-pollution-to-local-authorities-is-an-inadequate-response

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: Facilitate access and use of Automatic External Defibrillators (AED's)
attributes.background:
"In emergency medicine, the golden hour is the period following traumatic injury being sustained by a casualty, during this hour there is the highest likelihood that prompt medical treatment will prevent death."

For heart related emergency's the early use of an AED can be key for preserving life.
attributes.additional_details:
It is frustrating to know that AED technology is out there and publicly available and that many first aiders are trained in AED use.

I acknowledge and welcome this progress but it's difficult to get these two components together at the right place at the right time to make full use of the Golden Hour of patient care.

I ask parliament to vigorously consider the following:

1. Funding/grants so trained first aiders have their own AED.

2. A database of public AED's that can be added to mobile phone maps.

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Start a public consultation and debate about the future funding of the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in financial crisis. I believe it is now time for the electorate to be consulted for their views on how this might be resolved for the future, as successive governments appear to be struggling to find a solution.

attributes.action: Increased protection for beneficiaries under Mirror Wills following first death.
attributes.background: My father and stepmother prepared Mirror Wills whereby the estate first passed to the surviving spouse and then to my stepbrother and myself in equal shares.  After my father died my stepmother changed her Will and left everything to her own family.  I lost my family inheritance of approx £150,000
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the following changes. (1)  A  formal warning to be included in all Mirror Wills that your final wishes may not be respected should you die first.  (2) A new legal requirement than any beneficiary under a Mirror Will  subsequently disinherited must receive formal written notice for it to have effect.
My story has been featured in the National Press, television and radio and is included in the current  television series of the BBC production "Rip Off Britain"

attributes.action: Include the advertising ban and mandatory targets in the anti-obesity strategy.
attributes.background: We believe that the government's anti-obesity strategy does not go far enough. We want the advertising of junk food to be banned until after the watershed and for the manufacturers of junk food to have mandatory targets for sugar and fat content. We also demand that schools sell healthy lunches.
attributes.additional_details: See the Public Health England report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/sugar-reduction-from-evidence-into-action

attributes.action: Independent scrutiny into Lancs Teaching Hospitals handling of A&E downgrade
attributes.background: On 13th April 2016, it was announced that A&E department would be downgraded to an Urgent Care Centre. LTH said the A&E department would reopen in August but have now confirmed it will stay closed until a review in April 2017.
attributes.additional_details: There now needs to be an independent oversight and scrutiny of the decisions and actions taken by the CEO and board of Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust. The Health Select Commitee and Department of Health need to intervene in the ongoing situation at Chorley and South Ribble A&E.  It is imperative the management of LTH is held to account for their decisions and actions around the downgrade of the A&E department in April 2016 and subsequent actions taken to reinstate A&E.

attributes.action: Ensure that every train has a guard.
attributes.background: It should be a condition of offering a franchise to a Train Operating Company that every train has a guard. This improves safety and service and is reassuring for the travelling public, especially the elderly, disabled, and passengers with young children.

attributes.action: Improved education on Keeping Britain Tidy and stricter penalties for litterers
attributes.background: Our hedgerows, dykes, residential areas, countryside, roadsides, beaches and rivers, to name some, are strewn with litter and an absolute disgrace to our nation. Sadly some members of society have no shame in dropping their rubbish, thus believing it to be another's responsibility to clean up.

attributes.action: Stop Housing Associations charging more than social rent on their properties.
attributes.background: My 20 years old has a 1 bedroom Circle 33 Housing Association property and her rent in £189.00 per week.  Another Circle property 2 minutes away is £129.00 p/w. She is under so much stress and anxiety worrying about getting work and paying her rent and not ending up homeless.
attributes.additional_details: She will have to claim a portion of Housing Benefit as she will not be in a position to pay it all herself.  Surely if the rent was lowered there would be smaller claims for Housing Benefit, possibly no claims at all in some circumstances being made. Surely it is common sense to reduce the rent to reduce the amount of Housing Benefit claims being made.  There is nothing included the £189.00 rent, e.g. water rates or care taking facilities.

attributes.action: All public transport buses to have seat belts.
attributes.background: I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

attributes.action:
Car Tax Refund takes too long
Should be immediate from the day car sold
attributes.background:
There is no period of grace buying a car to taxing it The DVLA obtain immediate monies
Refund from selling a car takes up to 6 weeks.
You only get the refund from the following full month. That means there is an awful lot of surplus cash sitting somewhere. 
This practice needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
If a bank held onto our cash without letting us have our money there would be an outcry. Why should the DVLA hold onto our money.
As soon as a car is taxed online the DVLA must be made to give an immediate refund on the car that has been sold. Money is taken electronically therefore should be refunded electronically.

attributes.action: To scrap Grades 1 - 9 and go back to A - U grading/marking.
attributes.background: There is no standardised system or coherent system that any one school can take and use. The system is failing children as schools are unsure how to use the new marking system so the children suffer. This petition is highlighting the need to revert back to simple but effective A - U marking.
attributes.additional_details: As teachers we have a duty of care towards our children and if we are unable to mark correctly, the Department for Education is setting schools and children up to fail. We have not seen any good positive need for this marking system and we are now angry at having to use it over and above a perfectly good marking system used for many years prior. Children’s minds should not be bogged down with a complicated marking system. Go back to A - U, keep it simple and teaching improves.

attributes.action: Allow Spouses of Work Permit Holders to apply for ILR based on Domestic Violence
attributes.background: In June 2016,I finally sought help about the Domestic Violence against me. It was just 1 month before my husband would have obtained his Indefinite Leave to Remain(ILR). He now has a criminal record and may not get ILR. I am not eligible to apply for DV ILR because he is neither British nor Settled
attributes.additional_details: Under UK Immigration Law, only partners of British nationals/settled persons facing domestic violence (DV) can apply for settlement.This law forces people with abusive immigrant partners to stay on in the marriage.I have worked in the UK as a legal adviser for 5+ years but endured intense DV.I spoke out a month before my immigrant spouse would have acquired settlement.Now, I cannot apply for settlement for myself/2 kids born in the UK, just because I did not endure violence for yet another month

attributes.action: Protect the public sector from future Private Finance Initiatives (PFI)
attributes.background: PFI’s charge on average 15% interest pa for 30 years. We propose that all future public sector infrastructure projects should be paid for through Public Finance Initiative Bonds (PFIB’s) where members of the general public could invest via the post office into PFIB’s in return for a 5% interest p.a.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is currently paying £3,729 every minute to private companies as part of an annual repayment fee for building and operating new hospitals or redeveloping old ones.
PFIBs could replace PFIs and be similar to National savings bonds where the general public deposit money (say a minimum £1,000 for a minimum of 5 years) via the post office into a PFIB this would be used to build future public infrastructure projects. Even allowing for 5% operating costs this would reduce our costs by over 25%

attributes.action: Make all forms of non-medical genital mutilation of minors illegal
attributes.background: Any genital mutilation (GM) of boys and girls, even if they supposedly give consent, should be made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: GM for religious reasons is particularly heinous as it permanently marks the child as a member of a religion into which no child can be born only inculcated.

attributes.action: NO guarantee for EU nationals in UK without equality for Brits in EU.
attributes.background: Brits were encouraged for 30 years to invest in EU by buying houses for their retirement in a favourable climate for their health. Is it the wish of the British people for over a million UK pensioners to lose everything they have worked for all their lives?
